text: my name is nada
i am a professional services graduate
i joined aws six months ago
as a proserv graduate i am part of a
graduate program that lasts one year
during which i am trained to become an
expert in a specific field
mine is cloud architecture
as a cloud infrastructure architect
so i am part of the aws professional
services organization
that is a global team of experts that
will help customers achieve the business
outcomes they want when they're using
the aws cloud the biggest surprise since
i joined aws was the fact that i didn't
have to be an expert in the cloud
my interviewer just told me hey
we know that you're you don't have any
experience and this is actually what
we're offering you
we only need your leadership principles
and this is the only thing you're going
to be evaluated on during the whole
process
so i think that aws is a great place for
building a career
for different reasons
more specifically for people who are
passionate about
the cloud and more generally for a
technical or non-technical person
who wants to be stimulated all the time
who wants to have the opportunity to
evolve the possibilities are endless
not because you have a technical role
doesn't mean that you need to do
technical all the time you can do what
you like and i think it's even welcomed
at aws
